intro: Acisanthera variabilis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved acisanthera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its botanical features include hairy stems and capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ecological benefits in garden settings.
